description: Visual editor renders nested `Design` and `Preview` tabs under `Visual`
Top-level `Visual` and `Code` tab behavior remains intact after adding preview workflow
Preview session state initializes with idle compile/render/verify statuses
Switching preview source Sample<->Existing updates state without losing current design draft
Sample source renders at least three curated scenarios
Sample scenario payloads map to required renderer fields and numeric types
Existing invoice selector queries paginated invoice list with tenant scope
Existing invoice selector supports search term filtering
Selecting existing invoice fetches detailed invoice payload
Invoice payload normalization handles null/optional fields without crash
GUI workspace is converted into compiler IR containing all supported node types
IR extraction preserves parent-child hierarchy and layout metadata
Equivalent workspace inputs produce deterministic AssemblyScript output text
Code generation output includes field binding logic for supported field nodes
Code generation output includes table and dynamic-table row rendering logic
Code generation output includes totals calculations/formatting hooks
Code generation output includes style/layout declarations derived from GUI constraints
Compiler diagnostics map generated errors back to source GUI node ids when available
Transient preview compile uses same AssemblyScript compiler flags/options as production compile
Compile cache reuses artifacts when generated source hash is unchanged
Compile cache invalidates and recompiles when generated source changes
Compile failure state displays actionable error message in preview
Preview compile action performs no invoice/template DB writes
Preview render path executes compiled Wasm via same runtime used for real invoice rendering
Preview HTML/CSS output shape matches output contract of real render pipeline
Preview does not use design-canvas scaffold renderer for authoritative output
Rapid design edits trigger debounced compile+render runs rather than immediate unbounded recompiles
Manual rerun control triggers compile+render+verify even when no model delta is detected
Preview shows loading indicator during compile/render lifecycle
Preview shows empty state when no preview data is selected
Preview shows distinct verification-error state when layout check fails to execute
Preview mode blocks drag operations
Preview mode blocks resize operations
Preview mode ignores destructive shortcuts (delete/backspace)
Expected layout constraints extraction covers spacing/alignment/sizing/containment fields
Rendered geometry collector produces normalized bounding boxes for relevant rendered elements
Layout comparator passes when rendered geometry is within configured tolerance thresholds
Layout comparator fails when rendered geometry exceeds tolerance thresholds
Verification mismatch report includes failing constraint id, expected value, actual value, and delta
Preview UI displays pass badge when all layout constraints are satisfied
Preview UI displays issue badge when one or more constraints fail
Save action persists compiler-generated AssemblyScript source associated with current GUI design
Save action persists compiled Wasm artifact from generated source (or recompiles equivalently)
Code tab behavior for GUI templates follows defined source-of-truth rule
Switching between Visual and Code does not desynchronize generated source and GUI model
Workspace hydration from source/localStorage remains functional with compiler-enabled preview
Preview controls expose stable automation IDs
Compile/render/verify status indicators expose stable automation IDs
Verification mismatch list exposes stable automation IDs
Unit suite includes deterministic compiler golden tests for representative design fixtures
Integration tests prove preview render output parity with real runtime for same generated template and invoice data
Layout verification test fixture passes when design and render are aligned
Layout verification test fixture fails with expected mismatch set when render diverges from design
End-to-end flow covers design edit -> authoritative preview -> verification -> save
End-to-end flow covers existing invoice selection and authoritative preview update
Documentation is updated to describe GUI compiler pipeline and verification semantics
